utterance.speaker: CONSTRUCTION WORKER
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Hey pal, you can’t cut through here. It’s private property.

utterance.speaker: RUNNER
utterance.content: Sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: RUNNER
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Castle. I wish we could stay like this all morning.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Among other positions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what my favorite position is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In person.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, me too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Maybe I can fly up this weekend if there’s no new cases.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I would so make it worth your while.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh no. It’s the office. I have to call in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And there goes our weekend tryst.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, maybe not. Maybe it’s not a case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it’s always a case. Hey, uh, maybe, don’t you want to take a quick shower before work? Maybe you could take the phone in with you. It is waterproof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll hold you to that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘kay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pi.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Morning, Dad. I hope Pi and I didn’t wake you.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Making smoothies!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And yet, for me, not so smooth.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: I’ll whip one up for you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Good morning, all! Ah, Pi, I’ll have my usual. Anti-aging.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: You got it, Mrs. R.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, couldn’t you just pretend to appreciate Pi’s efforts?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What efforts? Half the time I don’t know if I’m smelling our new compost bin or my daughter’s rotting ambition.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Richard. She’s 19 years old and that boy is just – look, it’s good. She’ll get it out of her system.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just wish she’d get it out of her system faster. And out of my house. Maybe I should just put my foot down. Show her my stern disapproval.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Please. Alexis will just rebel and she’ll want to be with him even more.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then I should approve?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no. That’ll just cement the relationship. She’ll be sleeping on the couch with him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what should I do?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Drink your kale blast. And just ride it out, kiddo.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is that Charlie Reynolds? Turn that up.

utterance.speaker: NEWS REPORTER
utterance.content: … early this morning. Police are currently investigating. Reynolds was an actor, best known as a star of the 90s TV comedy “2 Cool For School” where he played lovable nerd Dewey Hancock. Fans across America mourn the loss of …

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, how awful. I did a guest spot on that show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was a simpler time, when Dewey’s catchphrase “hubba hubba” passed as sparkling dialogue.

utterance.speaker: NEWS REPORTER
utterance.content: In a bizarre twist, the body was found hanging from the hook of a construction crane.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, gruesome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, if by gruesome you mean awesome. Look, that’s Esposito and Ryan. This is exactly what I need. Former child star literally getting the hook. Wasted on his own petard. Hung out to dry.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay, I get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see that? He just declined my call!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Looks like Charlie isn’t the only one hung out to dry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I was –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You must be new here. I’m actually –

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: I know exactly who you are and like I said, only NYPD past this point.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s – there, there. Right there. Those are my people right here. Hey guys.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: It’s okay, Sully. We got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s that guy, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, that is Detective Grant Sullivan. As much as we miss Beckett, it’s nice to have a new guy to boss around.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you doing here, bro?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you would know if you would have answered my call.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I must not have heard it ring.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You rejected it. On live television.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, look. I’m big enough to overlook that and still offer to help you guys out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Help us out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is a high profile case. And I’m willing to let you guys exclusively benefit from my out of the box, crime-solving mind.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And what do you get?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Escape from life in the loft.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry, Castle. If Gates were to find out …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She won’t! She won’t find out! I happen to know she’s – she’s at a conference in Florida, so … you won’t even know I’m here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A washed up sitcom star hanging from a hook? Does it get any better?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I grew up watching this show. Charlie Reynolds is highly underrated as an actor. “2 Cool For School” is a timeless gem.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, I seriously doubt that. Not that I ever watched it.

utterance.speaker: SIDNEY PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Mr. Castle! You’re back. But not by popular demand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice to see you too, Perlmutter.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you have a time of death for us?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Uh, between 7PM and 2AM. The cause is obvious. He plummeted off the roof and landed on the hook.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Possible suicide.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Based on the crane’s distance from the building and signs of struggle on the roof, he was pushed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was Charlie Reynolds doing on the roof in the first place?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s a good question. He actually owns an apartment in the building, but he wasn’t living here. Every unit’s been stripped down to the studs, so he was staying in a sublet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any family or next of kin?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On the TV show, yes. In real life? Not so much.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, whatever he was doing here, I’ve got unis canvassing, seeing if anyone saw him or anyone else last night in the area.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm. Wonder what this means. Nine digits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, given he was pushed off a roof and landed on a hook, I’m saying that is not his lucky number.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yo Sully!

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Check out this number and see how it connects to our victim. And let’s start piecing together where he was before he wound up here.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: I’m on it. Meantime, I checked his voicemail. He had a bunch of angry messages yesterday from some chick. Said she would kill him if he didn’t call her back. Said she would not be ignored.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah hah. A classic rap boiler. A stalker, gentlemen. Obsessed fan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do we know who the caller is?

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Uh … … I traced the number to an address downtown. Uh … her name is, uh …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Geraldine Powers.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Uh, Geraldine Powers. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet she even has a creepy shrine to him.

utterance.speaker: GERALDINE POWERS
utterance.content: I did not kill Charlie Reynolds.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But you did threaten to kill him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Repeatedly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you do seem to have more than a casual interest in him.

utterance.speaker: GERALDINE
utterance.content: Well of course I do! I’m the one who kept the show on the air for six seasons.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you taking any medication?

utterance.speaker: GERALDINE
utterance.content: I am not delusional. I am Charlie’s agent, nitwit.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His agent?

utterance.speaker: GERALDINE
utterance.content: I’ve been running the shows nonstop since I got the news. I signed Charlie back in ’92, when he was on “2 Cool For School”.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: What do I do?

utterance.speaker: RAMON RUSSO
utterance.content: Stay cool. Chicks dig mystery.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Mystery.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: Oh, here she comes!

utterance.speaker: GERALDINE
utterance.content: After the show was canceled, the phone stopped ringing. Most agents would have dumped his ass, but me? I stuck with him. Oh, this is the scene. This is where history was made.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Hey Lisa!

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Hubba hubba!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Timeless gem, really?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That was a very … nuanced … performance.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nothing you’re telling me is explaining why you threatened Charlie Reynolds.

utterance.speaker: GERALDINE
utterance.content: Charlie moved into a sublet while his building was being rehabbed. And a few days ago some of his mail got forwarded here by mistake. His bank statement showed that he had just made a deposit for $125grand. Charlie could barely cover his rent with the jobs I’ve booked. So where did he get the cash? The only thing that makes sense is that he booked a gig on the side and cut me out of my commission.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you have any idea what that gig was?

utterance.speaker: GERALDINE
utterance.content: No. But for him to pull in that kind of money? It had to have been something big.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The key here is that mystery gig. A down on his luck actor barely scraping by? Maybe he got involved in some shady deal and it cost him his life.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or someone recognized his true acting talent and gave him a job.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like some C-list reality show where he has to mud wrestle Danny Bonaducci and Webster just to get a job with Donald Trump.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, what happened to Beckett’s desk?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s Sully’s desk now.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Oh, uh … Mr. Castle. Sorry if I came on a little strong back at the scene. I’m still trying to get the lay of the land here. Detective Beckett left some big shoes to fill.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah she did. I see you’ve filled her desk.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle! What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Captain Gates! I’m – I – I thought you were at a conference.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It ended a day early. But you wouldn’t even know that unless you were checking up on me. Oh, I see what’s happening here. This man has insinuated himself into the Charlie Reynolds investigation, hasn’t he? And you let him. Well, news for you, Mr. Castle. You are not NYPD. And you no longer have a reason for being here. This is our murder case.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL MCCORD
utterance.content: Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: This is our case now.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: I have a letter from the Attorney General authorizing our taking point on this case.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: May I see that, please?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What am I doing? What are you doing here? Why didn’t you tell me you were coming to town?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was going to surprise you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well done!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then perhaps you should brief the team.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Good morning, I am Agent McCord. Of course you know Agent Beckett. We’re joining this investigation, so we need access to all information regarding Charlie Reynolds death.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which is Fed speak for ‘you’re pushing us out’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you’ll continue to work the case, you’ll just be reporting to us.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, why is the death of a sitcom star a Federal case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not at liberty to say.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No, let me get this straight. You want us to continue investigating, report everything to you, but you’re not going to tell us why you’re here?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: It’s need to know. We’ll be setting up in the conference room. We’ll need any preliminary reports and all of Reynolds’s personal electronics, phones, iPads, computers. Thank you for your cooperation.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: We’ll use the victim’s phone and computer data to reconstruct what he was up to in this last 24 hours. And by the way, DC made it clear that they want us to send it to them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why do they want the data?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: They didn’t say. They rarely do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s gotta bother you.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: We don’t always get the whole picture. It comes with the territory.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we should go over there and invite them in for some coffee, you know?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We are not serving them coffee. You bought the espresso machine for the NYPD. This is NYPD coffee only.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, guys. That’s a little harsh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Harsh? Beckett’s a Judas. Her and her partner just hijacked out case. Who’s side are you on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your side. Guys, I’m – I’m on your side.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey Ryan, isn’t it a little weird Castle shows up the same day that Agent Beckett takes over?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, it’s quite a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, that’s not a coincidence, that’s – yeah, well. No, actually yes, it is a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe you and Beckett are in on this together. Maybe you are her inside man. You are Judas’s Judas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, guys! I swear! C’mon, you know me!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m watching you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Perlmutter’s got something for us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: After a complete examination, I was able to narrow time of death to between 11:30 and 1:30. And, perimortem bruising on the arm and should is consistent with signs of a struggle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Charlie fought back before he was thrown off the roof.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Yes, but the most fascinating discovery resides in here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: An unusually large quantity of fresh bird excrement that I extracted from the tread of the victim’s shoes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No – I’ll take your word for it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, so he stepped in some pigeon?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Sure, only it didn’t come from pigeons. A painstaking analysis proves that this is none other than chicken poop.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not a lot of that in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Charlie’s mystery job had something to do with chickens?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Well, after “2 Cool For School” almost anything’s a step up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now what else you got for us?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I’m afraid that’s all I’m authorized to tell you at this time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I can’t believe it. Even Perlmutter’s answering to the Feds now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re being iced out of our own case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, maybe there’s a perfectly reasonable explanation for all the secrecy. That’s – you guys are right. This is outrageous.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, Sully. Any leads on Charlie’s mystery job?

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Nothing that explain that $125 grand. The only thing I’ve been able to dig up so far is some personal appearance trips to Russia over the last few years.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Russia?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. “2 Cool For School” is huge over there. Dewey is to Russia what David Hasselhoff is to Germany.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Oh, I did catch a break on his credit card. I got a line on a cab that picked Charlie up the day he got killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where did it take him?

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: His sublet. But here’s the kicker. Another dude jumped in the back seat and the two of them got into a huge fight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you get a description?

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: No, better. I got a name. His former costar, Ramon Russo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh yeah, he played the jock, Marco, right?

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh. So you have seen the show.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I – caught it by accident once.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, well, then as you might know, not only did Ramon play Marco, word is they hated each other.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe that feud lead to murder.

utterance.speaker: RAMON RUSSO
utterance.content: It was an accident. I tried to walk away, but he pushed me first. I didn’t mean to kill him, I swear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ramon Russo!

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: My apologies, guys. I’m telling you, this happens to me all the time, whether I’m out there on the street or teaching class. So, how can I help you fellas? You want an autographed picture? What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How about some of your time?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe even decades of it.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: I’m telling you, Charlie’s death is a personal tragedy for me and a huge loss for the acting community.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: And I’ll do anything I can to help you find whoever did this to him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We understand you shared a cab ride with him yesterday.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: That’s right. We left work together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, you worked with him? On what? And did it involve chickens?

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: Chickens? What? No, we were doing “2 Cool For School”.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But that show’s been off the air for 20 years.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: No, man. We’re doing a reunion movie.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You are?

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I mean, that’ s just the first we’re hearing of it.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: It’s on the down low, you know. We all had to sign those confidentiality agreements. But to be honest, I had a lot of other projects in the works. Charlie begged me to do it. He said it would be fun to get the old gang back together, you know?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Even with all the bad blood between you two? I mean, wasn’t your character, Marco, originally supposed to be the star of the show? And then Dewey caught fire, stole the spotlight. Stole your spotlight.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: We were kids back then. I mean, that show did a lot of great things for all of us. Whatever issues we had, we buried the hatchet a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not according to your cabbie. He said the two of you got into a big fight.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: Yeah, I lost my temper because he was wasting my time. He was disrespecting the craft. Charlie didn’t know any of the lines. And I’m telling you, he was never like that. He was always real good with that kind of stuff, you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re saying there was something going on with Charlie.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: Definitely. It started a couple of days ago. He started showing up anxious and tired. And I asked him what was wrong, but he wouldn’t say.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where were you last night between 11:30 and 1:30?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Ramon’s girlfriend Yasmin confirms Ramon’s story. He was home all night running lines with her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lines like ‘I’m the biggest deal to ever walk these halls’. Ramon slipped me a signed copy of the script, “2 Cool For School: Those Who Can’t, Teach”.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who – wha – what’s the storyline?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dewey and Marco are back at Bayview High as faculty. Dewey is the brainy science teacher and Marco’s reliving his glory days as the football coach.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. When Dewey runs into the sexy German teacher Mrs. Pauseman In the break room he says –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE AND RYAN
utterance.content: “Hubba hubba.”

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Hubba hubba.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Anyway, I talked to the office at the movie set and not only has Charlie been acting weird lately, but two days ago he sweet talked the accountant into looking over the books.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would the star care about the budget of the show?

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: I don’t know, but the accountant told me that Charlie said he’d found irregularities. And get this, he made her swear not to tell the film’s producer, Hank Harper, that he’d been poking around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hank Harper, I’ve heard of him. Rumor was he chased a director off set with a baseball bat.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Check this out. Though he’s ever been convicted – – Hank Harper has faced numerous charges of embezzling money from the films that he’s worked on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If Charlie would have found out that Hank was skimming money from the movie –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then maybe Hank gave Charlie the hook.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to the production office, Hank Harper is somewhere here on the set. How can they even be filming? The star is dead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Probably scenes without Dewey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or scenes that explain why he’s not in the whole movie.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or he’s back from the dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Zombie apocalypse version. Now that would work.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, look! Right there!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look, there’s another one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They must be recasting the part.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What? There’s only one Dewey Hancock.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? Tell him that.

utterance.speaker: VLAD BARDINOV
utterance.content: Action!

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: Dewey, thanks for giving up a Friday night to chaperone the dance with me. I’ll see you there.

utterance.speaker: FOURTH DEWEY LOOKALIKE
utterance.content: Hubba hubba.

utterance.speaker: VLAD
utterance.content: No, no, no. Hubba hubba is not just a catchphrase. It is the essence of your character. Hubba hubba comes from here , not here . And Svetlana, make him work for the hubba hubba.

utterance.speaker: HANK HARPER
utterance.content: No, no. Forget it, please. C’mon, you’ve tried this before. The answer’s no.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hank Harper!

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: It’s too late, pretty boy. We already cast the muscular P.E teacher.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD. We’re here about Charlie Reynolds.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: I’ll have to call you back.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Charlie’s a great kid, a real pro. Working with him reminded me of the pitches I did with Pacino.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You worked with Al Pacino?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Barry Pacino. No relation. Every bit as talented. And taller.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If you have such a high opinion of Charlie how come you’re already replacing him?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: You have to understand, there’s a lot of money at stake here. The show must go on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, I’ve been there. My book, Nikki Heat, got made into a movie a few years back.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Didn’t that go straight to DVD?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There were script issues. And casting issues. And directing issues.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did Charlie have any problems with anyone on set?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Not that I’m aware of. Everybody loved him. What’s not to love?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He took a look at the accounting books recently. Any idea why?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Can’t imagine. Whoa, whoa, whoa. Easy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we might. Maybe Charlie thought somebody was skimming money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, we heard about your penchant for creative bookkeeping.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Whoa, you think I killed him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, if Charlie found out you were up to your old tricks it would be motive.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: First of all, I was here all night doing script changes. And plus, I may have been caught with my hand in the cookie jar in the past, but I’m not stupid enough to steal from the Russians.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Russians?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re financing this picture. They want to make this into a franchise. This is my meal ticket! So if there’s any hinky with the books, it’s not ‘cause of me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re not going to take your word for that. We’re going to need to see those books.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. They’re all yours.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re going to need one of these hats, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know what I don’t get?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re wearing that hat. There’s a lot you don’t get.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s say Hank embezzled money and killed Charlie to silence him. Why are the Feds involved?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe it has something to do with the Russians.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If we knew the Feds angle we’d have a leg up on solving this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry, guys. I have yet to come up with a crazy genius theory –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - yet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You don’t need to. Not when you can go directly to the source.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get Beckett to give us the lowdown.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, wait a minute.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We get much needed case information, you get to clear up any lingering doubts about your loyalty. Everybody wins.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, guys, no. I can’t do that, all right? After D.C we promised we wouldn’t –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We did you a solid getting you on this case, Castle. It’s time to pay up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, this is my fiancée, okay? What does it say about our future if I keep pushing the boundaries?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, your relationship is built on the foundation of your boundary pushing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I got your text.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. I just wanted to check in with you. You know, must be weird for you, being back here at the precinct, working a case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. Especially because McCord’s little gag order prevents you from accessing your most effective investigative tool. Me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you are a tool all right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So uh, she’s not here right now, so what’s the harm in giving me a little tidbit?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is a bribe. Castle, you’re bribing me with a latte?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No! I am not. C’mon, don’t be ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is low, even for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I can solve this. I just need a little more to go on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you’re not going to Castle me on this one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, she’s coming. Just … nod once if it’s about the Russians, twice if it’s about something else. Twice, about something else. Three times. What’s – what does that mean? What – how – I don’t know what that means.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: We’ve got a lead. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See ya, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does that – what does three nods mean?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I tried, but she won’t talk to me about the case.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, where did the two of them go just now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She wouldn’t tell me that, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I can’t even look at you right now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys? I think we found something in these books Charlie was looking into.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: I went over them and there are no signs of any financial shenanigans.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The balance sheet seems kosher, but um … check out this ledger entry.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That is the number we found in Charlie’s pocket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well this must be that irregularity that Charlie was talking about. But what does it mean?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It corresponds to an invoice number for a shipment of camera equipment for the movie sent over from Russia.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What makes that an irregularity?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, for one thing it would be a lot cheaper just to rent cameras here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not only that, but the shipment was sent to a warehouse in Brooklyn …

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: … which happens to be right next to a chicken processing plant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which explains the poop on Charlie’s shoes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Charlie when to that warehouse right before he was killed. Maybe whoever killed him came from there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks deserted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That doesn’t mean that it is. This place could be teeming with bloodthirsty Cossacks. Do you have an extra gun?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At least we know we’re in the right place. I definitely stepped in something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys, I found it. I found the shipment. Same invoice number.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It is just camera gear. Wait a minute. It’s a false bottom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ohh. My mother always said the film business was tough.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s why the Russians are financing that dumbass movie. They’re using the production to smuggle in illegal weapons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like Argo, but with guns.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Put the gun down and show me your hands! Now turn around slowly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell are you guys doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re finding the guns you’re looking for.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What guns?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You didn’t know about the guns?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: We came here to observe and report. We don’t know any more about this case that you do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then how did you guys get here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By retracing our victim’s movements.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: He came here the day he died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He must have come across these guns.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: I’ll contact the ATF, have them secure the weapons.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not so fast, Clarice. We’re the ones who found them, so NYPD’s going to be the one booking these into evidence.

utterance.speaker: ETHAN WRIGHT
utterance.content: That’s where you’re both wrong.

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: Those guns aren’t going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Put your weapon down, now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re the jogger. They guy who found the body.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Put the gun down. We’re Federal Agents.

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: I’m a Federal Agent, too. Name’s Ethan Wright, CIA. Have Mario Lopez here make the call. .

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Assuming you are who you say you are, why would the CIA be involved?

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: Charlie Reynolds was working for us. I recruited him two years ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dewey was a spy?

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: We used him to infiltrate the family of Anton Renkov.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anton Renkov? I know that name. He’s the most notorious gangster in all Russia.

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: He’s also a major fan of “2 Cool For School”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s why Charlie was taking all those trips to Russia.

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: That’s right. They love him there, so I approached him about using those trips to gather intel on Renkov and his organization. Charlie didn’t hesitate. He was good. Turns out he was a better actor than most people gave him credit for.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s what I’ve been saying.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, this guy checks out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh thank God, my arm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, Anton Renkov was using the movie as a front to smuggle arms into the US for the Russian mob. And Charlie’s job was to fond those guns.

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: More or less. He contacted me a couple of days ago. He told me he located the shipment. We set up a meet so we could get him a GPS tracker to attach to the guns. When he didn’t call I started looking for him.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Would have been nice if you told us sooner.

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: What can I say? It was need to know.

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: We needed you to monitor the investigation so NYPD didn’t get too close to the Russians to compromise our operation. We also figured you might lead us to the weapons, which you did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what happens now?

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: We hope that Renkov sends the guns on to wherever they’re going. So we can track them. You guys walk away.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can’t believe Charlie was spying on Anton Renkov and his organization. Any of them look familiar?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I saw about three of those Russians on the movie set.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Mmhmm. And according to Interpol all of them got criminal records back to the motherland. Assault, murder. All kinds of bad stuff.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I bet one of them found out Charlie was a spy and they killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Especially since we know Charlie was followed to the warehouse.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Based on what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We tracked Charlie’s movements by triangulating the cell towers that his phone pinged off of, and then we used that timestamp to pull satellite footage of the warehouse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you guys get there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Chicken poop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Well, whatever works. The point is that someone was following him. That’s what I’d investigate.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Actually, we need to hit pause on the investigation. Word just came down from DC.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: CIA doesn’t believe Renkov knows Charlie was a mole and they think the Russians would have moved the weapons if they knew.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’re not interested in the weapons. We just want to solve his murder.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: And DC has a problem with that. You talk to these Russians, you could kick up some dust. Set off their alarms about Charlie Reynolds and jeopardize the CIA operation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, so by pause what you really mean is stop.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: I know how you feel. But this case intersects with national security issues. I’m sorry, but it’s over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Got your text. What time’s your flight?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tomorrow morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So listen, I’m uh … I’m sorry about that whole bribe thing. I should have known you were incorruptible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I wouldn’t say that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huh. Well then, allow me to try to corrupt you, a little later at my place? Where we can finally have some alone time. And by alone time, I mean, you and me. And my mother. And Alexis. And Pi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That – that sounds … crowded.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Why don’t you just give me a call after you guys have solved the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, didn’t you hear McCord? Case is wrapped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This whole greater good thing blows. Charlie died serving his country. He deserves justice.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What happened to Beckett? She used to understand that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think she still does.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This must be the satellite footage Beckett was talking about.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And there’s Charlie entering the warehouse.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Uh, gentlemen? I take it you’re finishing up paperwork on the case that you are no longer investigating?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Good. Carry on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, you see him? Beckett was right. Charlie was followed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And look, he’s wearing a baseball cap to be incognito.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not incognito enough. Check out the design on that hat. Just like the “2 Cool For School” crew hat that I got. The one you made fun of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whoever followed Charlie came from the movie set.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks for your time. Guys, nobody at the production office saw Charlie being followed. But as soon as he was done filming for the day a PA gave him ride to a bodega in Brooklyn. That bodega? 5 blocks from the warehouse.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is the security cam footage from outside the bodega.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And based on the time stamp, this is when the PA dropped Charlie off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s him. There he is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, and … there’s our guy in the crew hat. I can’t quite make out his face.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Try a difference angle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m going to try zooming in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the actress from the movie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait a minute, she’s not just an actress. She’s also Svetlana Renkov. She’s Anton’s niece.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hubba hubba.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: So basically, your people did exactly what I told them not to do.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You put us in a difficult spot when you decided that the CIA’s agenda was more important than solving a murder.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: I did not decide anything. Orders came down.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: This is not my first rodeo dealing with the folks down in DC. Soon enough the name Charlie Reynolds will be a distant memory for you. But not for us. He may not have had a grieving mother or a wife waiting for him, but his killer should not go unpunished.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Regardless, I can’t let you take a run at Svetlana Renkov.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, the whole reason the CIA is shutting this case down is because they are convinced the Russians didn’t realize that Charlie was a spy. But Anton’s niece following Charlie seems to contradict that. And if the Russians did get on to Charlie wouldn’t the CIA want to know their mission is compromised?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Okay. In the spirit of containment. Let’s talk to Svetlana.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: You followed him. You followed him to the warehouse.

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA RENKOV
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did he go there?

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: He was looking for guns.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: And that was when you realized he was about to betray your family, so you told them.

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: I told no one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn’t even tell your Uncle Anton, or your other relatives?

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: No. I knew Charlie was a spy. But I never said so to my family. I would die first. We were in love.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: I can show you our love letters.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ha! You mocked Dewey, but not only was he a secret agent, look at that. He was a stud.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Romeo and Juliet. With a nerdy Romeo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And a smoking hot Russian Juliet.

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: We fell in love the moment we met. Two years I only saw Charlie when he came to Anton’s parties in Russia. He knew I wanted to get away. Away from that life. So when Anton financed the movie, Charlie said it was a perfect chance for me to come here. For us to be together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, if all of that’s true then why did you trail him to the warehouse?

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: To beg him not to look for those guns. I was afraid my family would find out.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: And did they?

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: No. If they knew I would be dead, too. I told him to stop, but Charlie wouldn’t listen to me. He said he needed to finish this one last mission before we disappeared.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What do you mean, disappeared?

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: We were going to run away and start over. We were supposed to leave today. Get away from my family, get a fresh start. Charlie wanted to leave everything behind. The spying, the acting, the stupid character of Dewey.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What about his apartment? He spent a lot of money renovating it.

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: He was leaving that, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, he could have gone to the roof to get one last look at the place. Say goodbye.

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: He didn’t have to. He knew it was in good hands. He was giving it to a friend. That’s why he was there that night.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Who’s the friend?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s not who I would have expected.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He was hiding in plain sight this whole time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ramon. You’re under arrest.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now, Ramon, you told us that you had other projects in the works. That you did the reunion movie as a favor to Charlie.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: For old time’s sake. That’s what friends are for. That doesn’t make me a killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, we looked into these, uh … other projects, and well, this is what we found.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’ve been working the graveyard at Globalese Security for four years.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: Well, you know. Acting has its ups and downs, you know. I know I’ll be back in the game soon enough.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, especially if playing the football coach in “2 Cool For School” turned out to be a recurring gig.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The plan was to make sequels, but if Charlie bailed there wouldn’t be any.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’d be back to working security.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: I didn’t hurt Charlie. I have an alibi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Not anymore. See, your girlfriend admitted to us that she lied for you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She also mentioned that you borrowed her credit card that night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turns out that you used it to charge a cab ride. To Charlie’s building.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You never told us that Charlie was going to let you stay in his apartment because you knew it connected you to the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: I can explain. I can explain everything, okay?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s over, Ramon.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: No, no, no. No, look. He was doing a scene, and after that he told me he was leaving. And I don’t mean just for the day. He was leaving for good. He wanted a fresh start. He had been out of work as long as me. And now we had a shot at doing these movies. You don’t walk away from that kind of opportunity. That kind of money.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How did you end up on the roof?

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: Because he asked me to meet him there. So I thought maybe he changed his mind, so I went. So there we were, looking at the great view. And he’s saying to me that I can stay at his place for free. I don’t want no charity! I don’t want to be housesitting. I want my career back! And he ruined it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So you just snapped.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: You know, when I was in the show, I had money. For girls, for cars, for clothes, for whatever. And then, bam! All of it’s gone. Nobody tells you what it feels like when it’s gone, you know? Plenty of people around you to help you spend it, though.

utterance.speaker: RAMON
utterance.content: I just wanted my old life back.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We’re getting a full confession. Thanks to you, in large part.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Don’t be a stranger, Agent Beckett. Drop by and see us sometime.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, sir. I will.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why is Svetlana still here?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: The CIA asked us to hold her.

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: Svetlana, this is your opportunity to honor Charlie’s memory. To carry on his work.

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: You’re asking me to spy on my family?

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: You have unprecedented access to Anton Renkov and his organization. That is extremely valuable to us.

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: Do you know what they will do to me when they learn of this?

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: They could learn of this right now. If word somehow got out that Charlie was CIA, your family would ask some pretty tough questions.

utterance.speaker: SVETLANA
utterance.content: You would do this to me?

utterance.speaker: WRIGHT
utterance.content: Not if you help us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s bluffing. CIA’s not just going to expose her like that.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I wouldn’t bet on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The man that she loved was murdered and he’s going to send her on a suicide mission?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Like I said, we don’t always see the whole picture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think this one’s pretty clear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks good. Type it up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey yo, Sully. Nostalgic file.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Thanks, friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. I’m off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Good to see you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Think McCord’s going to miss us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah. Desperately. But I’ll be there to pick up the pieces.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Was that CIA spook really forcing Svetlana to take Charlie’s place?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s not right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but you know. There’s not much that we can do about it.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Oh, uh … I’m going to clean that up, I swear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no. This is your desk now. And uh, … from what I can tell, you earned it.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Thanks. That means a lot coming from you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check this out.

utterance.speaker: NEWS REPORTER
utterance.content: Police are investigating former “2 Cool For School” star, Ramon Russo, for the murder of Charlie Reynolds. Sources close to the case say Russo’s motive may be tied to Reynolds’s relationship with co-star Svetlana Renkov, who is currently under investigation for her alleged tied to Russian organized crime.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, where’d they get that? Svetlana’s not under investigation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe someone fed them a bad tip.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Once that news hits her family, they’re going to cut ties with her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’ll be no good to the CIA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Too bad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Playing the anonymous source card? I mean, that is pure genius. It – it actually makes me love you more.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she’s filing for asylum and the state department is gonna help relocate her, so hopefully that will keep her safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but even working for the Feds you found the ultimate way to honor the victim. Charlie died trying to get Svetlana away from her dangerous family. You completed his mission.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but you would have done the same thing, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, and I would love me more for doing it, too. Um … hey. Listen, um … we really have to talk about something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ve been doing this long distance thing for months, and uh, honey, and we never see each other. And when we do, it’s day here, it’s a weekend there. Let’s face it, it’s not – working.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – I know, Castle. But I don’t – I don’t know how to fix this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What … is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a key. To our DC apartment. I mean, the truth is, I can – I can write anywhere, so I found a place with a little home office. Listen, if you don’t like it when you see it we can always –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! I don’t need to see it. I love this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hold that thought.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bought Mother, Alexis, and Pi an overnight yoga retreat. They should not be home until morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, I thought our flight was at 8 in the morning.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: It is. They know it was you that tipped off the press.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: A part of me really admires you for the choice that you made, maybe because I’d like to think there was a time that I would have done it. But the people we answer to don’t feel that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rachel, I – I

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Kate, you’re one of the best agents I’ve ever worked with.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: But I’m here to tell you you’re fired.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
